issue.title: Hidden window taking focus

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Bug reports and bugfix pull requests

repository.name: glfw
repository.description: A multi-platform library for OpenGL, OpenGL ES, Vulkan, window and input

issue.body:
Hi,
I'm loving this new GLFW because it makes the most obvious things possible, such as the ability to write a program that starts off in a hidden window, say for example, for running graphics scripts in the background without wanting to have window pop up and disrupt my active work on my computer. I don't know if there is a more obvious way to do that, but this way definitely works very well. However, I am still having one minor issue with it. The hidden window is still taking focus. For example, if I'm typing on a terminal while a separate script is running that opens my glfw-based programs in a hidden window, what I'm typing quits going to the terminal I'm on. The focus goes to hidden window. Is there a way to prevent that from happening? If so, could someone let me know how? If not, I'd like to request a way to do so.
Thanks,
Sean

issue.title: Always-on-top window hint

repository.name: glfw
repository.description: A multi-platform library for OpenGL, OpenGL ES, Vulkan, window and input

body: I suggest `GLFW_FOCUSED` as the name for the latter.

Would its default be true then? I think false defaults are better, if possible, since these are debug/dev oriented optional flags (i.e., most of the time they won't need to be touched). `GLFW_NOT_FOCUSED` maybe?
@shurcooL Default true would be more consistent. See [supported and default values](http://www.glfw.org/docs/latest/window.html#window_hints_values).
In that case, `GLFW_FOCUSED` with default true sounds good to me. Consistent is better.

rename.from: New window hints for always-on-top and initial focus

body: `GLFW_FLOATING` has been added with 3ce7bfef073c44f632acfafaaa102b774dfed10d. `GLFW_FOCUSED` remains to be done.
